Existence of laws on sexual harassment (1 = YES; 0 = NO)
COMMENT_OBS: Data are based on UN Women review of laws including penal codes and labour laws as well as specific domestic violence and sexual offences laws. COMMENT_OBS: Data are based on documents produced by Member States and the UN system for the Universal Periodic Review (UPR). The UPR is a unique process that involves a review of the human rights records of all 192 UN Member States once every four years. The UPR is a State-driven process under the auspices of the Human Rights Council which provides the opportunity for each State to declare what actions they have taken to improve the human rights situations in their countries and to fulfil their human rights obligations. All documents are available at: http://www.ohchr.org/en/hrbodies/upr/pages/uprmain.aspx
